articles.title: Welcome to my Dear Data postcard
Sevryn_site
articles.description: Welcome to my digital space where I merge healthcare expertise with a passion for data and design. Here, you’ll find insights into health data analytics, reflections on my journey in nursing, and explorations of how data can transform patient care. Dive into my blog for latest updates, visit the portfolio section to see my projects, or learn more about my background on the About page. Enjoy your stay!

articles.title: Severine Kouagheu
articles.contents:
Sevryn_site
          
          
          Home
          My Shiny App
          My New Analysis
          My Dear Data postcard
          About
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Severine Kouagheu
          
          
            
              Hello! I’m a licensed nurse currently advancing my
              expertise with a Master of Science in Health Data
              Analytics. My journey in healthcare is driven by a passion
              to integrate clinical knowledge with data-driven insights,
              aiming to improve patient outcomes and healthcare
              efficiencies.
              Beyond my professional life, I have a deep appreciation
              for the finer things in life like fashion, photography,
              and the joy of experiencing new things. I believe in
              living life to the fullest and finding beauty in everyday
              moments.
              Family and faith are central to my life. Residing in
              Ayer with my loved ones and drawing strength from my faith
              in God, I find balance and inspiration in both my personal
              and professional endeavors.
              Whether through my academic pursuits or when capturing
              life’s beauty through a camera lens, I strive to bring
              passion and precision to everything I do. I look forward
              to connecting with like-minded professionals and exploring
              opportunities that blend my healthcare expertise with my
              love for data and aesthetics.

articles.title: Healthcare Access and Disease Impact Across Demographics
articles.description: An in-depth analysis of healthcare utilization during the flu and COVID-19 pandemic, focusing on disparities across different races and ethnicities. This study highlights areas that may require targeted healthcare interventions.
articles.contents:
# Load necessary libraries
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the dataset
health_data <- read_csv("healthcare data.csv")

# Prepare data for plotting
case_data <- health_data %>%
  group_by(race, ethnicity) %>%
  summarise(flu_cases = sum(flu_2022), covid_cases = sum(covid), .groups = 'drop')

# Plotting the data
ggplot(case_data, aes(x = race, y = flu_cases, fill = ethnicity)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = position_dodge()) +
  facet_wrap(~ethnicity, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(title = "Flu and COVID-19 Cases by Race and Ethnicity",
       x = "Race",
       y = "Number of Cases",
       fill = "Ethnicity") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))



I visualize the distribution of flu and COVID-19 cases across different races and ethnicities, and see how healthcare services were utilized by these groups. This analysis might provide insights into healthcare accessibility or outreach effectiveness during the pandemic.
This approach provides two separate plots:
Flu Cases:
Displays the number of flu cases recorded in the dataset for each race, divided by ethnicity.
COVID-19 Cases:
Similar to the flu cases plot but for COVID-19.
These visualizations can help identify disparities in healthcare coverage or disease impact among different demographic groups, highlighting areas where healthcare interventions might need to be focused.
